meanings.definition: The quality or state of being trig or trim.
meanings.sent1: Her trigness in dressing always impressed everyone at the party.
meanings.sent2: The trigness of the garden made it a peaceful place to relax.
meanings.sent3: The cat's trigness in grooming itself was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: The trigness of the ship's sails caught the wind perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The trigness of the sculpture's lines gave it a sense of elegance.

meanings.definition: The condition of being trig or neat.
meanings.sent1: His trigness in organizing his desk made finding things easy.
meanings.sent2: The trigness of her handwriting made it a pleasure to read.
meanings.sent3: The trigness of the puzzle pieces made it satisfying to complete.
meanings.sent4: The trigness of the city streets after the rain was refreshing.
meanings.sent5: The trigness of the flower arrangement brightened up the room.
